util.linalg

Class GivensRotation

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.linalg.GivensRotation

  • public class GivensRotation
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a givens rotations, which is a matrix of the form G = [ ... ; cosine, ..., sine; ... ; -sine, ..., cosine; ... ], a rotation of a certain angle that affects two rows of a matrix when applied to a matrix from the left A = Gt * A, and affects two columns of a matrix when applied to a matrix from the right A = A * G
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andrew Guillory gtg008g@mail.gatech.edu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GivensRotation(double theta)
      Create a new givens rotation
      GivensRotation(double a, double b)
      Create a new givens rotation which when applied from the left to a column vector V = [..., a, ..., b]t where a and b are the ith and jth entries in the vector produces a column vector [..., r, ..., 0]t = Gt * V that has zero in the jth position and some value r in the ith position.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void applyLeft(Matrix m, int i, int j)
      Apply this rotation from the left to the given matrix.
      void applyRight(Matrix m, int i, int j)
      Apply this rotation from the right to the given matrix.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GivensRotation

        public GivensRotation(double theta)
        Create a new givens rotation
        Parameters:
        theta - the angle of the rotation

      • GivensRotation

        public GivensRotation(double a,
                      double b)
        Create a new givens rotation which when applied from the left to a column vector V = [..., a, ..., b]t where a and b are the ith and jth entries in the vector produces a column vector [..., r, ..., 0]t = Gt * V that has zero in the jth position and some value r in the ith position.
        Parameters:
        a - the entry in the ith dimension

    • Method Detail

      • applyLeft

        public void applyLeft(Matrix m,
                      int i,
                      int j)
        Apply this rotation from the left to the given matrix. Sets M = Gt * M.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to apply the rotation to
        i - the first row to affect in the rotation
        j - the second row j > i to affect in the rotation

      • applyRight

        public void applyRight(Matrix m,
                       int i,
                       int j)
        Apply this rotation from the right to the given matrix. Sets M = M * G.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to apply the rotation to
        i - the first column to affect in the rotation
        j - the second column j > i to affect in the rotation
